Then, on November 24, 1859, the result of Darwin’s lifetime of research, The Origin of Species, was finally published.

As soon as the book was released, all 1,250 copies

of the first printing sold out, making it a bestseller.

Darwin was pleased. However, now a different problem emerged.

While open-minded intellectuals praised the book, conservative religious leaders and upper-class nobility at once denounced Darwin’s theory of natural selection.

Blasphemy!

This book shows

disrespect

toward God!

While the criticism grew, Darwin wrote letter upon letter, dozens every week,

to those whom he thought would listen to him. Through his letters, Darwin sought to explain his theory of natural selection and convince others of its value.
